workout_file.description: Threshold Development: This training is targeting the increase in lactate threshold (FTP) with relatively short intervals at intensity of Zone 4.
workout_file.name: Week 5.4 - Threshold Development

textevent.message: Welcome to our 2nd Threshold Development workout of week 5! Let's get started with a warmup :-)
Let's also take a quick look and make sure you have your fluids, fan, and towel all set!
3mins into it, hopefully you've decided on your playlist :-)
That's halfway! Let's chat a bit about what's planned for today.
So, as you know, today is another Threshold Development day in the 6wk Beginner FTP builder.
This training is targeting the increase in lactate threshold (FTP) with relatively short intervals at intensity of Zone 4.
We'll accomplish this with some cadence work at zone 3 first.
Then move onto 2, 5min intervals, right at FTP, with a short rest between.
In total, we'll get 24mins at zone 3, and 10mins at zone 4 today! That's a fair bit of work for sure :-)
1 min to go for this portion of the warmup, then we'll continue it with some higher intensity work.
Now, let's steady the power for a couple of minutes and increase your cadence to 90 RPM.
In 10 sec, we're lifting the power to zone 3, and cadence is going up to 95 RPM.
Just a little more effort here, keep warming up and preparing for the day!
All right, our last step up in the warmup is 1min right at FTP, at 100 RPM.
FAST FEET!
Excellent work! Now, let's take a nice full 5mins recovery and get ready for our main set.
We'll catch up with 1 min to go.
All right, today we're starting with some cadence work at zone 3.
More specifically, we'll alternate 3mins at 60 RPM, and 3 mins at 90 RPM, 2 times.
So, a total of 12 mins. Then, we'll take a nice long break, and repeat it :-)
All right, we're starting seated at 60 RPM here, get ready!
Let's bring the power up and the cadence way down. This should feel like a grind.
If you have any knee discomfort, please spin faster!
In 10sec, I want you to come up to standing keeping the effort and cadence the same.
Stand up for 1min!
Good work, sit back down again for this last minute, but keep grinding it out.
Get ready to lift the cadence to 90 RPM...
Spin 'em up here! Make the transition from slow to normal cadence smooth.
In 30sec, we're going to reduce the cadence again and grind it out...Get ready!
All right, bring the cadence back down to 60 RPM and STAND UP!
Sit back down again, keep grinding it out! Push, scrape, pull, and kick your feet.
Stand up again for the last minute of this interval rep!
Excellent work! Sit back down again and spin the legs up to 90 RPM! Just 3mins to go.
Final minute! Keep it going here!
Keep it up all the way to the arch!
Excellent work! That's 1 down, and 1 more of those to go!
We'll take a full 6mins recovery now, and catch up again with 1min to go.
Ready to repeat that again? We'll do the same alternating of low and high cadence.
As well as throw in some standing work for good measure :-)
Ready? Start to slow your cadence down...
Let's bring the power up and the cadence way down. This should feel like a grind.
If you have any knee discomfort, please spin faster!
In 10sec, I want you to come up to standing keeping the effort and cadence the same.
Stand up for 1min!
Good work, sit back down again for this last minute, but keep grinding it out.
Get ready to lift the cadence to 90 RPM...
Spin 'em up here! Make the transition from slow to normal cadence smooth.
In 30sec, we're going to reduce the cadence again and grind it out...Get ready!
All right, bring the cadence back down to 60 RPM and STAND UP!
Sit back down again, keep grinding it out! Push, scrape, pull, and kick your feet.
Stand up again for the last minute of this interval rep!
Excellent work! Sit back down again and spin the legs up to 90 RPM! Just 3mins to go.
We're headed right into a threshold effort in 2mins, so take a few deep breaths here.
Try and recover as best you can under pressure and prepare to dig just a little deeper!
Final minute! Keep it going here!
In 30sec, we're lifting the power up right to FTP and cadence up to 90-100 RPM...Get ready to dig!
PUSH IT! Lift the power and the cadence here! You can do this!
4mins to go...Stay with it here!
That's halfway! Don't let the power drop off here. Keep your cadence nice and quick!
C'mon! This is the last minute! PUSH PUSH!
Don't let up! Push all the way to the arch!
Nicely done! That's the hardest thing we'll do today, especially after the zone 3 interval.
We'll take a few minutes easy, then finish up with 1 final FTP interval.
Ready for our last interval today? You look to be! We're keeping the cadence 90-100 RPM again next.
Push it! This is the last bit of work for today, you got this!
Settle down here, find the rhythm and roll with it. Ignore the fatigue in your legs.
We're halfway again here! You're doing incredible! Release the tension in your shoulders.
Last big push to the line! Get the cadence as close to 100 RPM as you can for this last minute.
DIG DIG DIG! Don't let your cadence drop!
Get to the arch!
Woo wee! That was a GREAT day and excellent effort by you today!
We're going to spend a few minute cooling down now, then we have another one in the books.
Enjoy the last few minutes of the cool down, and we'll see you next time!
